column2: Historical Development Timeline
column5: Prominent Figures (not including founders or prophets)
column8: Rituals, Practices, and Ceremonies not covered under 'religious celebrations'

column2: Historical Development Timeline: Emerged in 6th century BCE
column3: major split between Theravada and Mahayana around 1st century CE

column2: Geographical Distribution: Predominant in Southeast and East Asia
Demographic Breakdown: More practiced by older age groups, gender balanced
Prominent Figures: Buddhist Emperor Ashoka, Dalai Lama
Art & Architecture: Pagodas, intricate thangka paintings
Cultural Impact: Emphasis on peace, non-violence, and mindfulness
Rituals, Practices: Daily meditation, monk ordinations
Viewpoints towards Science & Tech: Generally neutral, some concerns about distracting technologies
Education & Morality: High importance on education, moral conduct
Conversion & Evangelism: Not aggressive, personal spiritual journey
Famous Literary Works: "Dhammapada", "Lotus Sutra"
Historical Development Timeline: Originated in Arabian Peninsula in 7th century CE
Geographical Distribution: Wide distribution in Middle East, North Africa, Central and Southeast Asia
Demographic Breakdown: Younger demographic, gender segregation in prayer
Prominent Figures: Caliphs, Imams, Muslim scholars
Art & Architecture: Mosques, geometric and arabesque patterns
Cultural Impact: Sharia law, halal diet, modest attire
Rituals, Practices: Five daily prayers, annual pilgrimage (Hajj)
Viewpoints towards Science & Tech: Encouraged in understanding the natural world
Education & Morality: Strong emphasis on education, moral integrity
Conversion & Evangelism: Personal decision, no forceful conversion
Famous Literary Works: "Quran", "Hadith"
Historical Development Timeline: Originated in India around 1500 BCE
Geographical Distribution: Mainly in India, Nepal, Bali
Demographic Breakdown: Older demographic, more males than females
Prominent Figures: Mahatma Gandhi, Swami Vivekananda
Art & Architecture: Temples adorned with deities' statues
Cultural Impact: Yoga, vegetarianism, caste system
Rituals, Practices: Yoga, puja (devotional ceremony), samskaras (life-cycle rituals)
Viewpoints towards Science & Tech: Valued for improving life, not for spiritual enlightenment
Education & Morality: Knowledge as a means to realization, moral conduct stressed
Conversion & Evangelism: Rare, through personal experience and understanding
Famous Literary Works: "Bhagavad Gita", "Vedas"
Historical Development Timeline: Evolved from Jewish sect in 1st century CE
Geographical Distribution: Diaspora in many countries, esp. USA, Israel
Demographic Breakdown: Evenly spread among age groups and genders
Prominent Figures: Albert Einstein, Golda Meir
Art & Architecture: Synagogues, Star of David motifs
Cultural Impact: Emphasizes ethics, monotheism, and history
Rituals, Practices: Sabbath observance, bar/bat mitzvah
Viewpoints towards Science & Tech: Encouraged, considered gifts from God
Education & Morality: Essential for religious living, moral obligations
Conversion & Evangelism: Encouraged, but not forced
Famous Literary Works: "Talmud", "Torah"
Historical Development Timeline: Originated in Iran in 6th century BCE
Geographical Distribution: Predominant in Iran, India, and smaller communities worldwide
Demographic Breakdown: Balanced across age groups and genders
Prominent Figures: Zoroaster, Cyrus the Great
Art & Architecture: Fire temples, metalworks featuring Faravahar symbol
Cultural Impact: Dichotomy of good (Ahura Mazda) and evil (Angra Mainyu)
Rituals, Practices: Fire ceremonies, pilgrimage to holy sites
Viewpoints towards Science & Tech: Encouraged, contribute to human progress
Education & Morality: Value wisdom, truth, and ethical living
Conversion & Evangelism: Rare, often influenced by cultural ties
Famous Literary Works: "Avesta", "Zend-Avesta"
Historical Development Timeline: Emerged in 8th century BCE
Geographical Distribution: Predominant in Greece and the Mediterranean
Demographic Breakdown: Primarily ancient Greek population
Prominent Figures: Socrates, Plato, Aristotle
Art & Architecture: Temples, sculptures, plays
Cultural Impact: Philosophy, democracy, arts
Rituals, Practices: Animal sacrifice, athletic games in honor of deities
Viewpoints towards Science & Tech: Natural philosophy, understanding the world
Education & Morality: Emphasis on virtue, wisdom
Conversion & Evangelism: None, tied to ethnic identity
Famous Literary Works: "Iliad", "Odyssey"
Historical Development Timeline: Originated in Scandinavia around 1000 CE
Geographical Distribution: Mainly Iceland, Norway, Sweden, Denmark
Demographic Breakdown: Primarily Norse populations
Prominent Figures: Leif Erikson, Snorri Sturluson
Art & Architecture: Wood carvings, runestones
Cultural Impact: Epics, sagas, seafaring culture
Rituals, Practices: Blot (sacrifice), sumbel (toasting ritual)
Viewpoints towards Science & Tech: Shamanic beliefs, animism
Education & Morality: Oral tradition-based moral code
Conversion & Evangelism: Christianity replaced it
Famous Literary Works: "Eddas", "Sagas"
Historical Development Timeline: Developed in ancient Egypt around 3100 BCE
Geographical Distribution: Predominant in ancient Egypt
Demographic Breakdown: Ancient Egyptians
Prominent Figures: Tutankhamun, Cleopatra, Akhenaten
Art & Architecture: Temples, pyramids, hieroglyphics
Cultural Impact: Myths, rituals, astronomy
Rituals, Practices: Mummification, offering rituals
Viewpoints towards Science & Tech: Prized knowledge, astronomy, and mathematics
Education & Morality: Scribes and priests held moral authority
Famous Literary Works: "Book of the Dead", "Book of Going Forth by Day"
Historical Development Timeline: Originated in China in 16th century BCE
Geographical Distribution: Predominant in China, Taiwan, Singapore
Demographic Breakdown: Mainly Chinese
Prominent Figures: Confucius, Mencius, Laozi
Art & Architecture: Temples, calligraphy, landscapes
Cultural Impact: Filial piety, social harmony, meritocracy
Rituals, Practices: Ancestor veneration, ceremonial tea
Viewpoints towards Science & Tech: Encouraged, valued for progress
Education & Morality: Virtues (Ren, Yi, Li, Zhi, Xin), exam-based civil service
Famous Literary Works: "Analects", "Tao Te Ching"
Historical Development Timeline: Originated in India in 15th century BCE
Geographical Distribution: Predominant in India, Nepal, Caribbean
Demographic Breakdown: Mainly Indian
Prominent Figures: Ramakrishna, Vivekananda
Art & Architecture: Temples, statues, textiles
Cultural Impact: Non-violence, casteless society, vegetarianism
Rituals, Practices: Yoga, meditation, aarti
Viewpoints towards Science & Tech: Valued for understanding natural laws
Education & Morality: Emphasis on knowledge, self-realization
Conversion & Evangelism: Rare, focus on self-improvement
Famous Literary Works: "Bhagavad Gita","Vedas"
